Description: Floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup or bowl; wholly glazed; impressed decoration on interior consisting of circle of enclosed ovules around part of a zone of tongues or a rosette. Light brown clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For the impressed design, see Agora P 16465 (Sparkes, Agora XII no. 498 pl. 50), a stemless cup date about 420 BC (tongues and circle of ovules); Agora P23619 (Sparkes, Agora XII no. 592 pl. 54), a cup-skyphos dated about 410 BC (rosette). Shape of the fragment uncertain from photographs.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 46, no. D5, pl. 19, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1676)
